description.narrative: The project site, Mbeya district, situated at a distance of 1300 Kms South West of Arusha and characterized by high levels of abject poverty manifested by chronic food and income insecurity and malnutrition among women and children and lack of access to social services such as health and education. Women and children make the majority of those living in absolute poverty. Environmental degradation in the form of soil erosion and deforestation is rampant across the district. Over a period of 5 years, the proposed project aims at improving income and food security for 270 families (135 original and 135 pass ons) in Italazya, Iyunga, Mapinduzi, Mbangala, Igogwe, Ifiga, Mbawi, Nshea, and Nsalala communities of Mbeya district through placement of improved dairy cows. Each family will receive in-calf heifer, the first offspring of which will be passed to the next beneficiary family. Along with livestock placement, the project will provide training in improved livestock husbandry, HPI cornerstones for just and sustainable development, integration of crop farming to livestock, family nutrition and environmental conservation. Training in gender and HIV/AIDS prevention and control will be an integral component of project activities. To ensure that the project is sustainable and the assisted groups move toward self-sustenance, groups capacity building will be done in the form of training, inputs support, group revolving funds establishment and registration of farmers groups to associations as preparation towards exit strategy.
